title: Rear Brake Caliper - Assembly

body.body: Never use mineral-based grease (such as lithium or copper based grease) in any area where contact with the braking system hydraulic seals and dust seals is possible.
Mineral-based grease will damage the hydraulic seals and dust seals in the calipers and master cylinders.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Before installation, all internal brake components should be cleaned and lubricated with clean new DOT 4 brake fluid.

Never use solvents, petrol (gasoline), engine oil, or any other petroleum distillate on internal brake components as this will cause deterioration of the hydraulic seals in the calipers and master cylinders.
A dangerous riding condition leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident could result if this warning is ignored.
If all components are serviceable, obtain a piston seal kit and reassemble the caliper as follows:
The rear brake caliper is a precision machined component.
Do not attempt to split the rear brake caliper in two halves.
Internal components and seals are not available as spare parts.
The piston seal has a chamfer.
The dust seal has a groove.
Lubricate the fluid seals, caliper bore and the outside of the pistons with clean DOT 4 brake fluid.
Make sure all components are clean, then fit the new seals to their grooves in the caliper bores.
Ease the pistons squarely back into the bores, taking care not to displace the piston seals and dust seals .
The brake caliper has been sectioned for clarity.
